content:
According to the Master Document, we should do this:

  • Create a topic per stable/beta nominations, i-nominated and prs-waiting-on-team
    • create a topic once an issue is nominated/PR waiting on team.
    • send a text with directives on what to do on every nomination or PR waiting on team that is like ...
      • Sanity check if the nomination/pr waiting is really for T-compiler/libs-impl
      • We want to add them to the agenda with some basic information about why the issue was nominated/waiting, what's the status, etc
  • Create a topic per P-critical and P-high regressions
    • create a topic once an issue is tagged with P-critical/P-high regression.
    • send a text with directives on what to do on every one of them like ...
      • Ping appropriate people and/or notification groups.
      • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
      • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.

So I think we should define the procedure for these events and add that into #73247.
cc @Santiago Pastorino, should I create a separate HackMD for this?
@LeSeulArtichaut ohh I see you were saying the same, I was saying on another thread here :)
yes
Hehe
So what I think we should do
I guess we can use what we have https://hackmd.io/WJ0G17DHTHGgv0OW9I2PxA?view or tweak it a bit ?
Either that or just add it later
I think we should have the ready PRs merged
why don't we add what we already have in the document and maybe tweak it more if needed later?
And just edit that later once there is no timer/synchronisation to do
Feel free to add commits to my branch if you need
I can't right now, if you can't neither let's merge as it is and I can tweak it later
@Santiago Pastorino Please merge, thank you very much
r+ed with rollup=always, so this will be merged today probably
we need to keep an eye on this so we merge the other one once this one is in

I-prioritize procedure

  • Check if the issue is relevant to the compiler team (compiler or libs-impl issue), if not remove the request for prioritization.
  • If the issue needs bisection and/or MCVE, label it accordingly with E-needs-bisection and E-needs-mcve and ping the Cleanup Crew with @rustbot ping cleanup
  • If the issue is relevant to a specific notification group, e.g. LLVM or Windows related bugs, ping the notification group with @rustbot ping <group>
  • Discuss the priority of the bug with the rest of the WG
@Santiago Pastorino Is this the kind of message you would like to see sent when an issue is requested for prioritization?
i think that's too verbose to be putting it on every issue
Yeah I think so too
We need a minimal and verifiable procedure? :D
yeah something like that but I agree is too verbose
maybe we can have something minimal with a link to the procedure hackmd
one nice thing about that is that we can tweak the message without opening a PR and all that

I-prioritize procedure

  • Relevant to the team?
  • Needs bisection/MCVE?
  • Relevant to notification group?
  • Priority?
:+1:
That cannot be any more concise :P
yeah I'm not the one that is worried about making it concise
Can I add a link to a header? I bet not
it doesn't bother me and it would be good for newcomers and as reminder for all of us

LeSeulArtichaut said:

Can I add a link to a header? I bet not

yes, you can
I've done that in the topics I've opened before the meeting
Nice :D
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/2020-06-11.20I-nominated
check there for instance
Do we already have a HackMD for the procedure? Or do we need to write one?
I saw we have one
But I'm not sure it is finished?
Talking about this one
yeah, let's use that one and try to improve it
feel free to make it better
Will try :slight_smile:

So for the concise messages:

Prioritization procedure

  • Relevant to the team?
  • Needs bisection/MCVE?
  • Relevant to notification group?
  • Priority?

Nominations procedure

  • Relevant to the team?
  • Prepare agenda with:
    • Summary (area, cause, type, etc...)
    • Status
    • Why was it nominated?

High priority issues procedure

  • Ping notification groups?
  • Ping appropriate people?
  • Unassigned? Assign or add to meeting.
  • If applicable, prepare agenda with:
    • Summary (area, cause, type, etc...)
    • Status
    • Assignee
If that looks good I can open a PR
@LeSeulArtichaut looks good
at least as a way to start :)

LeSeulArtichaut said:

So for the concise messages:

Prioritization procedure

  • Relevant to the team?
  • Needs bisection/MCVE?
  • Relevant to notification group?
  • Priority?

Nominations procedure

  • Relevant to the team?
  • Prepare agenda with:
    • Summary (area, cause, type, etc...)
    • Status
    • Why was it nominated?

High priority issues procedure

  • Ping notification groups?
  • Ping appropriate people?
  • Unassigned? Assign or add to meeting.
  • If applicable, prepare agenda with:
    • Summary (area, cause, type, etc...)
    • Status
    • Assignee

@LeSeulArtichaut please remember what's the status of this?
I'm not sure if you've already added that text and the PR is waiting or if this is pending in some todo list :)
No, this is TODO
The PR without procedure landed
But the inclusion of the procedures in the messages is TODO
Well I didn’t see your last message
I’m going to file a PR and r? you
ohh great :)
@Santiago Pastorino Opened #73695
Here are the rendered messages:

@WG-prioritization issue #{number} has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

#{number} has been nominated for discussion in T-compiler meeting.

Procedure

  • Already discussed?
  • Worth the meeting time?
  • Add agenda entry:
    • Why nominated?
    • Assignee?
    • Issue? PR? What's the status?
    • Summary and important details?

PR #{number} has been requested for beta backport.

Procedure

Prepare agenda entry:

  • Why nominated?
  • Author, assignee?
  • Important details?

PR #{number} has been requested for stable backport.

Procedure

Prepare agenda entry:

  • Why nominated?
  • Author, assignee?
  • Important details?

PR #{number} is waiting on T-compiler.

Procedure

  • Prepare agenda entry:
    • What is it waiting for?
    • Important details?
  • Could be resolved quickly? Tag I-nominated.

Issue #{number} has been assigned P-critical.

Procedure

  • Notify people/groups?
  • Assign if possible?
  • Add to agenda:
    • Assignee?
    • Summary and important details?
  • Other actions to move forward?

Issue #{number} has been assigned P-high and is a regression.

Procedure

Is issue assigned? If not:

  • Try to find an assignee?
  • Otherwise add to agenda:
    • Mark as unassigned.
    • Summary and important details?
Any feedback is welcome :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: cc @DPC
Side note: I removed the pings everywhere aside from I-prioritize as asked during yesterday's meeting
@LeSeulArtichaut this is great :heart:
@LeSeulArtichaut now I wonder if we should remove the pings for the non I-prioritize elements or if we should just make all the pings be the notification wg
